gobblin.writer.commands

Class BaseJdbcBufferedInserter

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.writer.commands.BaseJdbcBufferedInserter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JdbcBufferedInserter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenericJdbcBufferedInserter, MySqlBufferedInserter, TeradataBufferedInserter

    public abstract class BaseJdbcBufferedInserter
extends Object
implements JdbcBufferedInserter
    Base implementation of JdbcBufferedInserter. Concrete DB specific implementations are expected to subclass this class.

      • insertBatch

        protected abstract boolean insertBatch(PreparedStatement pstmt)
                                throws SQLException

        Parameters:
        pstmt - PreparedStatement object
        Returns:
        true if the insert was successful
        Throws:

      • createPrepareStatementStr

        protected abstract String createPrepareStatementStr(int batchSize)
        Constructs the SQL insert statement for the batch inserts, using the INSERT_STATEMENT_PREFIX_FORMAT
        Parameters:
        batchSize - size of one batch
        Returns:
        the constructed SQL string for batch inserts

      • insert

        public void insert(String databaseName,
                   String table,
                   JdbcEntryData jdbcEntryData)
            throws SQLException

        Inserts entry into buffer. If current # of entries filled batch size or it overflowed the buffer, it will call underlying JDBC to actually insert it.

        Inserts entry. Depends on the current batch size, buffer size, param size, it can either put into buffer or it will actually call underlying JDBC RDBMS to be inserted. The number of input columns is expected to be equal or smaller than the number of columns in Jdbc. This is to prevent unintended outcome from schema evolution such as additional column. As underlying Jdbc RDBMS can declare constraints on its schema, writer will allow if number of columns in Jdbc is greater than number of input columns. number of input columns <= number of columns in Jdbc
        Specified by:
        insert in interface JdbcBufferedInserter
        Throws:
        SQLException
        See Also:
        JdbcBufferedInserter.insert(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, gobblin.converter.jdbc.JdbcEntryData)

      • executeBatchInsert

        protected void executeBatchInsert(PreparedStatement pstmt)
        Submits the user defined insertBatch(PreparedStatement) call to the Retryer which takes care of resubmitting the records according to JdbcBufferedInserter.WRITER_JDBC_INSERT_RETRY_TIMEOUT and JdbcBufferedInserter.WRITER_JDBC_INSERT_RETRY_MAX_ATTEMPT when failure happens.
        Parameters:
        pstmt - PreparedStatement object

      • resetBatch

        protected void resetBatch()
        Resets the list of rows after the batch insert

      • createInsertStatementStr

        protected String createInsertStatementStr(String databaseName,
                                          String table)
        Populates the placeholders and constructs the prefix of batch insert statement
        Parameters:
        databaseName - name of the database
        table - name of the table
        Returns:
        INSERT_STATEMENT_PREFIX_FORMAT with all its resolved placeholders
